result.execSummary:
The defendant Daryl A. Zierk was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Daryl A. Zierk is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Daryl A. Zierk was found guilty of Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Huber allowed.    It is the Court's expectation that all non-working hours are to be spent in the KCJ subject to the authority granted to the Sheriff under the Statutes.

records.addlTxt: Bond applied; partial refund;  gb/jg    ck#16CH076296
clarification from clerk tl that bond refund processes
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge
For Cts 1 & 3 only - Dismissed.

Minutes:  15CF698/15CM965.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Michael Cicchini.  Defense put corrections to the PSI on the record.  Victim rights compliance.  Victim present; statement made.  Sentencing arguments made.  Deft stipulates to restitution in the amount of $2650.47.  Deft agrees to have the restitution taken out of bond money.  

15CM965 - deft sentenced to 120 days KCJ.  Credit for 32 days.  To commence 5/28/16 by 6pm.  Huber allowed.  It is the Court's expectation that all non-working hours are to be spent in the KCJ subject to the authority granted to the Sheriff under the Statutes.  Costs to be taken out of bond.  Balance may be returned to poster.

15CF698 - sentence w/held; placed on probation for two years.  See conditions.  Costs to be taken out of bond.  Balance may be returned to poster.

Firearms which were seized from the deft may be released to whomever designated by the Divorce Court.  DNA ordered; notice given to deft.  Appeal rights.  Firearm warning.  Voting acknowledgment.
Sentencing hearing on May 6, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Sentencing hrg for 5/4/16 needs to be rescheduled due to court's unavailability
Bail/Bond Signed
No contact with victim M.Z.  Amended bond form signed by defendant.

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Michael Cicchini.  Clerk K. Zirbel. Counts 1 and 3 - Dismissed on State motion.  Count 2 - Plea of guilty; found guilty by the Court.  Presentence investigation ordered.  Sentencing 5/4/16 at 1:30.  Condition added to bond:  No contact with victim M.Z.
Submitted by Atty Michael Cicchini
Jury selection at 03-21-2016 09:00 am
Final pre-trial at 03-01-2016 10:00 am
Status conf of 1/20/16 removed from court's calendar; dates given for FPT/JS; notice sent
Atty M Cicchini
Clerk Lehman sent email to Atty Cicchini of the next court date

Minutes:  15CF698/15CM965.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty John Ward.  Atty Ward moves to w/draw.  Court grants the motion.  Deft reports he has retained Atty Michael Cicchini.  Status set for 1/20/16 @ 9:15am.
received from deft & Atty Ward's office stating the case is resolved

Minutes:  15CF698/15CM965.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty John Ward.  Defense requests a short adjournment.  Offer was relayed but the deft needs additional time.  Leave on for JS for 12/14/15 @ 9am.  Parties to notify the court by 5pm on 12/2/15 if the case is settled.  NO plea bargaining will be allowed after that time.
940.44(2) -Intimidation of Victim, DV   813.12(8)(a) -Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Injunction  2cts.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty John Ward.  Ongoing negotiations, mutual request for an adjournment.  FPT set for 11/23/15 @ 1:45pm.  Complaining witness present.  Defense moves the court to lift the no contact order.  Complaining witness wishes to have contact w/deft as well.  Court lifts the no contact order between the deft and his family.
for Bond Modification

No objection by the defense.  FPT adj to 11/5/15 @ 10:45am, JS 12/14/15 @ 9am.  Court will allow defense counsel to file any motions at the FPT.
